clinical_study.brief_title: The Mechanical,Physiological and Therapeutic Effects of Eccentric Exercise Combined With Extracorporeal Shockwave Therapy in Athletes With Patellar Tendinopathy
clinical_study.official_title: The Mechanical,Physiological and Therapeutic Effects of Eccentric Exercise Combined With Extracorporeal Shockwave Therapy in Athletes With Patellar Tendinopathy

brief_summary.textblock: Patellar tendinopathy is one of the most common injuries in jumping athletes. Changes in mechanical and physiological properties of tendon are the two proposed forms of pathogenesis. The efficacy of eccentric exercise when applied alone and combined with extrocoporeal shockwave therapy had been reported; however, the underlying treatment mechanisms of pain and dysfunction are not clear. This project aimed to explore the mechanical, physiological and therapeutic effects of eccentric exercise when applied as a single treatment and as an adjunct to extracorporeal shockwave therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Tendon stress in pascals at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Tendon stress measured by ultrasonography and dynamometry

primary_outcome.measure: Change of tendon stress in pascals at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Tendon stress measured by ultrasonography and dynamometry

primary_outcome.measure: Change of tendon stress in pascals at 16 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Tendon stress measured by ultrasonography and dynamometry

primary_outcome.measure: Tendon vascularity index as percentage at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Tendon vascularity measured by power doppler ultrasonography

primary_outcome.measure: Change of tendon vascularity index as percentage at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Tendon vascularity measured by power doppler ultrasonography

primary_outcome.measure: Change of tendon vascularity index as percentage at 16 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Tendon vascularity measured by power doppler ultrasonography

arm_group.description: 12 weeks eccentric exercise combined with 6 sessions of extracorporeal shockwave therapy in the initial 6 weeks
12 weeks eccentric exercise combined with 6 sessions of sham extracorporeal shockwave therapy in the initial 6 weeks

intervention.description: Knee eccentric exercise with sham or focused extrocorporeal shockwave therapy for 12 weeks
intervention.other_name: Extracoporeal shockwave therapy (Minilith SL1, Storz Medical)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Competitive athletes
- Pain at the inferior pole of the patella with training for at least 3 months
- Tenderness at the inferior pole of the patella on palpation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patellofemoral pain syndrome, fat pad irritations, meniscus injury, osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis or infections
- History of fracture over lower limbs and inflammatory myopathies
- Cortisone injuection and other interventions within 3 months
- Contraindication to extracorporeal shockwave therapy
